author: Mark
message:
... ups, pressed post, before I wanted. I am not sure, if the following would qualify as an extra mile bug: All or nearly all plasma-components do not have a "report bug" feature like all KDE apps which makes it more difficult to report bugs on them, because one has to find the right component. The same goes for the systemsettings modules. I have reported some of them as bugs, but given up, since no one seems to care. The best would be if all plasmoids and all systemsettings modules would kind of automatically receive a report bug function. I believe this would be a great help for users reporting bugs and for the volunteers who have adjust the bug components manually. 
At least adding it to all the plasmoids should meet the criteria "easy to fix".
I would report this as an extra mile bug, if you agree that it fits in the category,

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message:
It is a bit "meta", as in: fixing this would help people write better bug report, but I agree that could help improve the quality of Plasma applets and SystemSettings modules, so I would vote yes.

The question is, where should this link be added. A possible candidate for Plasma applets would be to add a Help button on the left of the config dialog, which would be a menu with entries like "About this applet" and "Report a Bug". Something similar could be done for SystemSettings modules by turning the existing Help button into a menu button.

replies.author: Mark
replies.message: The config dialogue seems like a good place, but the context menu where it exists could also be an option.

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message: Adding a "Report Bug" entry to the context menu would be a bit too much I think, but maybe this help submenu could also appear in the context menu.

replies.author: Mark
replies.message: Just in case this is turned into an extra mile bug, would I need to open reports for every systemsettings module and plasmoid?

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message: Hopefully not: I hope we can address this in the components used to create Plasma applets and system settings modules, so that it does not require changes to all of them.
